content.description:
Within Range climbs the obvious gray dihedral on great rock before traversing left on to the face for a steep and exposed finish.

Start at the base of the dihedral and make difficult moves to the second bolt. Stemming and good footwork take the bite out of this part. Above, a lot of fun laybacks climb the dihedral feature and through a small bulge before easier terrain on orange rock above. Above the sixth bolt, reach left for the seventh bolt and using good holds traverse out of the dihedral and onto the gray face of the buttress. Finish with interesting movement on great, featured rock to the anchor.
content.location: Leftmost route on the Hole Wall, starting in the obvious, gray dihedral.

content.description:
This is a good warm-up for the area and doesn't have the hard crux of

Within Range

, instead offering a more sustained climb.

Climb an initial steep section with the easiest line just right of the bolt line for the first two bolts, making use of good holds on the right and sharp, fine edges on the face. At the third bolt, traverse left to a set of good holds before moving up to clip the fourth bolt. The climbing stays fairly sustained around the fourth bolt before easing up considerably in the upper part of this climb before the anchors. The upper part features orange rock with a plethora of little "bubble" features on the rock, provding for interesting texture and holds.

This route is a pleasant affair with good, textured rock but it could still use some brushing/climbing/cleaning to help bring it into prime shape.

The name comes from a great song by some Northwest hip-hoppers, Blue Scholars. Life has been busy (newborn, teaching, online masters, etc., etc.), but I just can't stay away from climbing.
content.location:
This is just right of

Within Range

, the gray, right-facing corner on the left side of the Hole Wall.

content.description:
Gray Expectations is another great East Canyon climb on excellent rock. The rock on this pitch is particularly featured with little bubbles of lime, providing for interesting texture on many of the holds.

The climb starts with a steep, but short overhanging section with some long moves and interesting sequences through the first few bolts before the grade eases. A gentle section of climbing leads to fun climbing on wildly textured and beautifully incut holds to thin climbing up the obvious gray streak at the top.
content.location:
Climbs the obvious gray streak at the top of the wall on the left side of the Hole Wall. Starts 10-15 feet to the right of

Black Beauty

.

content.description: Starting below the hole, carefully navigate your way up the right side of the hole. Above, find sustained climb characterized by a lot of righthand sidepulls. A break in the routine is offered at the top where featured climbing leads to the anchor.
content.location: Start just right of the distinctive guano-filled hole that gives this wall its name.

content.description: Climb into the ugly, guano-filled hole and lean left to clip the first bolt. Traverse left to a crux headwall, then go up a groove and over a bulge to a wobbly finish.
content.location: This route is directly left of the big "hole" in the wall.

content.description:
Black Beauty is a quality line on great, beautifully featured limestone. The guidebook only gives this one star but I thought this was a route very deserving of 3 stars.

Scramble up some low-angle, easy but chossy terrain to the first bolt. Start with steep climbing on good holds to a difficult crux at the third bolt which is best climbed to the left. This crux on its own is probably at least 11+. Above, the difficulty eases and you can get a good rest at some nice, big incut jugs. Finish on beautiful gray limestone with a difficult crux that the guidebook describes as "techno slab." I'm not sure what "techno slab" is but when I first encountered the crux I was completely stymied and a little miffed by how "weird" it felt, especially when there is a line of good holds 5-10 feet left. After figuring things out, incorporating a sequential sequence, I fell in love with this upper section. The rock is great and once you unlock the puzzle at the top it's a real treat.
content.location:
On the left side of the Hole Wall, about 50 feet right of

Within Range

.
